Articles.Content: Me too.

One at a time. Sheesh. In due time. Give me some time to Prepare. I'll save the Big dog with the CPU melters for last. Alpha, You're up first. I'm doing one capital ship and two escorts that're around 60ish tons. I'll have a persist up later.

One at a time. Sheesh. In due time. Give me some time to Prepare. I'll save the Big dog with the CPU melters for last. Alpha, You're up first. I'm doing one capital ship and two escorts that're around 60ish tons. I'll have a persist up later.

Perfect, that'll be one Wesselton and two Squid. I'm prepared.
Can I join the fight? I'll use the ship I just posted. It's untested.

Oh that will be fun. 2 Posterus and 1 Nouvelle. The first combat test for both designs. Also, please don't put more than 2 ships within 10 km of each other. My cpu will roll over and die.(Put them in different orbital altitudes.)

Edited August 18, 2015 by Alphasus
Same with the CPU issue. I use a copy without BD for my Space Combat so the Distance is 2.5 for me. This is why I'm waiting. My new Destroyer Prototype.
How much does it weigh?
Sorry about the persist. After I got back from work I didn't feel like lifing so I passed out. It'll be up soon. Tell Sharkman I said thank you for the idea of a Dres battle.
Welll, there goes his sanity. Thanks for accepting.
Due to you being the Defensive fleet I'll let you set up the persist. I would like to however set a cap of 4 ships plus one capital ship. No tonnage rules, just a cap.
I need a tonnage rule. If I make x tons, will you do the same?

Welll, there goes his sanity. Thanks for accepting.
Sorry about the persist. After I got back from work I didn't feel like lifing so I passed out. It'll be up soon. Tell Sharkman I said thank you for the idea of a Dres battle.

Oi! I see that!
Alpha it's up to you. You're the defender.
Fine then, will set it up when I am on a computer.

Hello everyone, I am developing the loveable yet (hopefully) deadly Oberon-Class _____, that _____ Is one of the parts I need help with, because I have no clue how to class ships, it weighs 66.5tons and is quite small, but with inspiration from Zamovinar's Cruiser-Carriers fighter-engine pods, it's two arnaments are deadly arnaments, being designed to detatch from the ship, close in on the target and get to the right distance, fire a missile, and attatch back onto the ship, they're WIP atm, it is quite short and I think it's kinda cute, but it wont be when it's holding up against a larger ship, so if anyone can tell me how to class it, please do, and if anyone wants screens, then ask and I will provide. Thanks.
Screens please, recommendation is light cruiser. I posted my classing system on the first page of our company thread(It will be competing with the posterus in weight).

But, of course!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The Controllable-Fighter-Missile-Pods are WIP, I need to add some more advanced manuevring so it can actually get back in place without extremely complicated manuevre.

On another note, the battle fleet is ready.

Around dres, the 3rd Strike Group of the SAP-C Conglomerate is in orbit around dres. Determined to keep control of Dres to land military bases there, a fleet of 3 state-of-the-art ships has been assembled.

Two of the Posterus-class Light Cruisers are assembled, the Posterus and the Trecut. Weighing 65 tons each and equipped with 6HighVelocityHighMass Missiles, she has heavy armor and twin engines to propel her.

The lead ship of the strike force is the Nouvelle, a cruiser with double-layered armor, twin 1.25m Pheonix missiles, and 6HighVelocityHighMass Missiles. She also has 2 engines, and 4 ion engines. The engines are covered in thick structural plate.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The Controllable-Fighter-Missile-Pods are WIP, I need to add some more advanced manuevring so it can actually get back in place without extremely complicated manuevre.

Yes, Light Cruiser is just fine for that. She is quite light with a good TWR and her armor isn't as good as the battlecruiser, so she is lighter.

Edited August 20, 2015 by Alphasus

All thats in my head right now is DUN DUN DUN DUN DUDUNDUN DUNDUNNNN from star wars and this image of a fleet of massive ships with a massive nuclear engine exhaust behind them, with Dres looming in the distance, while an Attila is waiting for them there, except the roles are actually opposite in the scenario right now.

All thats in my head right now is DUN DUN DUN DUN DUDUNDUN DUNDUNNNN from star wars and this image of a fleet of massive ships with a massive nuclear engine exhaust behind them, with Dres looming in the distance, while an Attila is waiting for them there, except the roles are actually opposite in the scenario right now.

I don't have the luck to be fighting an Attila. Believe me, I wish that I am.

It's like Mulan then, they're up against Attila the Hun and have no chance, while I'll make a man out of you plays in the background, if I could make a cinematics I would be rendering a Nouvelle charging an Attila head-on, while two Posteruses loom in the background, as if they were saying "are they insane?"

My Attila was my first real test to see what works and what doesn't. I've learned a lot from the Attila and incorporated everything I learned into my Vindicator. The Vindicator is the pinnacle in Warship Technology. Also You're the Defensive fleet. Bring what you wish. I need to engineer lighter ships. Maybe a Corvette. The CCS Vindicator is my Capital ship being accompanied by two escorts (Undecided ships).
